articles.title: Sports Complex of KPA Inaugurated in Presence of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Sports Complex of KPA Inaugurated in Presence of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Sports Complex of the Korean People's Army was inaugurated in the presence of General secretary Kim Jong Il.
					The sports complex with a plottage of nearly 10,000 square meters is a modern sports complex having sports facilities for all kinds of events including basketball, volleyball and indoor football, cultural and welfare facilities and all amenities for spectators.
					
					 Vice Marshal of the KPA Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, vice-chairman of the NDC and minister of the People's Armed Forces, made an inaugural speech.
					
					 Kim Jong Il looked round the exterior and interior of the magnificent sports complex. He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that soldier-builders have successfully built one more great structure meeting the need of the era of Songun in a short span of time and highly appreciated their shining feats.
					
					 At the end of the inaugural ceremony, he together with the senior officials who accompanied him watched a match played by sports groups of the KPA on the occasion of the inauguration of the complex.
					
					 To develop sports is of very weighty importance in augmenting the country's might by successfully pushing forward the revolutionary struggle and construction and boosting the friendly relations with various countries of the world, he said, setting forth important tasks to serve as guidelines for rapidly developing the nation's sports.
					
					 Present at the inaugural ceremony were senior officials of party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk, Ju Kyu Chang, Kim Chang Sop, Ri Myong Su and members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK  Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Myong Guk, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Choe Pu Il and Kim Yong Chol and Hyon Chol Hae, department director of the NDC, Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, service persons of the KPA and sports persons of the army.

articles.title: Japanese Detained in DPRK for Their Crimes
articles.content:
Japanese Detained in DPRK for Their Crimes
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency Wednesday issued the following report: 
					 Masaki Furuya, former representative managing director of JP Dairin Co. Ltd., Hidehiko Abe, representative managing director of Realise Co. Ltd, of Japan, and Takumi Hirooka, managing director of Sugita Industrial Co. Ltd, of Japan, were put in custody by a relevant body on charges of drug trafficking and counterfeit after entering Rason City of the DPRK on March 14. 
					
					 They admitted their crimes and their gravity. 
					
					 Masaki Furuya had already been expelled from the DPRK and the two Japanese are called to legal accounts. 
					
					 What they did is a very grave violation of the law of the DPRK and international law and they will, therefore, face proper legal actions.

articles.title: Remains of British Airman Handed to British Side
articles.content:
Remains of British Airman Handed to British Side 
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The remains of Desmond Fredrick William Hinton, British airman who died during the Korean War, were handed to the British side via Panmunjom on Wednesday. 
					 In 2002, the government of the UK officially proposed the DPRK government to unearth the remains of Hinton according to the ardent request of his bereaved families for the discovery of his remains as his whereabouts remained unknown for several decades. 
					
					 Authorized by the DPRK government, the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army conducted a series of survey which led to accurately unearthing and ascertaining the remains of Hinton and relics left by him and buried them on the spot with care as requested by the bereaved families and provided them with facility so that they might visit his grave. 
					
					 In March this year, the bereaved families asked for bringing his remains back home. 
					
					 The KPA Panmunjom Mission unearthed his remains and relics again with the sincere cooperation from the side of the British embassy here, respecting their intention, and handed them to the side of the bereaved families. 
					
					 It is the second time for the KPA to send back the remains of the dead British soldier. The remains of J. Edmuns, a second class private of the British Army, were handed to the British side on October 30, 1995. 
					
					 Expressing deep gratitude to the government of the DPRK for having made every sincere effort for this humanitarian undertaking, the British side predicted that such cooperation would mark a good occasion in developing the relations between the two countries. 
					
					 The Panmunjom Mission of the KPA clarified the stand to render positive cooperation in the future, too in unearthing and sending back remains, the humanitarian work for healing the wounds caused by the past Korean War.

articles.title: Delegation of Kim Il Sung University Leaves for China
articles.content:
Delegation of Kim Il Sung University Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Il Sung University led by President Song Ja Rip, minister of Higher Education, left here Wednesday to visit China. 
					 The delegation was seen off at the Pyongyang Railway Station by Kim Kyun, first vice-president of the university, and Hao Xiaofei, minister councilor of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of the Agency for the Diplomatic Corps Service of the Implementing Agency of the Government of Mongolia led by Deputy Director Tserendorj Ganbold arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Chinese Tourists Sightsee in Rason Area
articles.content:
Chinese Tourists Sightsee in Rason Area
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Chinese people toured the River Tuman basin and Rason area on April 29 and 30.
					 The tour was part of the ring-shape tourism covering Korea, China and Russia, the first of its kind in the three countries.
					
					They went round historic sites and other tourist attractions in the areas.
					
					They also visited Rajin Port and other economic establishments.

articles.title: 13th Pyongyang Symposium on Medical Science Held
articles.content:
13th Pyongyang Symposium on Medical Science Held 
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang symposium on medical science of Koreans at home and abroad took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday and Wednesday. 
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health including Ri Pong Hun, chairman of the C.C., the Medical Association of Korea, and medical scientists and members of the delegation of the Korean Health Workers Association in Japan led by Chairman Kim Yong Il.
					
					 Ri Pong Hun in his opening address hoped that the symposium would make positive contribution to the development of the nation's medical science and prosperity of the country in the idea of "By our nation itself". 
					
					 Kim Yong Il in his congratulatory speech called on the Korean medical workers in the north and the south and abroad to contribute to developing the medical science of the nation and achieving national reunification.
					
					 The symposium heard such papers as "A clinical study on cardiac valve replacement by right anteriothoracotomy," "A clinical study on the establishment of rational cardiopulmonary bypass method for primary repair of Tetralogy of Fallot," "The study on the growth and its characteristics in triplets," "The study to elucidate the character of some hormone and ferment revels according to constitutional types" and "The study for the clinical effect of acne vulgaris with the rocking-wave electropharmotherapy controlling by computer and the improvement of the curative efficiency of acne vulgaris with the complex physical therapy."
					
					 Introduced in the papers were research achievements and experience gained in the course of settling the scientific and technological problems arising in practice of public health and applying the cutting-edge scientific and technological achievements to the prevention and treatment of diseases.
					
					 Diplomas were awarded to those who presented the papers at the symposium.

articles.title: National Workers Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
National Workers Sports Contest Closes
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The national workers sports contest was closed with due ceremony at the gymnasium of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex Wednesday. It was opened on April 26 on the occasion of the 121st May Day.
					 The contest brought together at least 600 men and women players selected from various provinces. Its participants competed in football, basketball, hurdle and swing events. 
					
					 Trophy cups, medals and commendations were awarded to Pyongyang City which came first in the team standing and to other successful organizations and players.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, made a closing address.

articles.title: Telemedicine Service in Korea
articles.content:
Telemedicine Service in Korea
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A nationwide telemedicine service has proved effective in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Several hundred people have benefited from the service over the past two and half years.
					
					 The service is undertaken by experienced medical workers of different hospitals, including Kim Man Yu Hospital, Pyongyang Medical College Hospital, Oncology Institute, Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, Skin-disease Preventive Centre and General Dental Hospital.
					
					 In particular, the service renders much assistance to those suffering from brain and heart diseases in their surgical operations.
					
					 The telemedicine service is free in the country.

articles.title: Bio-Lotion Good for Facial Treatment
articles.content:
Bio-Lotion Good for Facial Treatment 
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A bio-lotion developed by Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry is enjoying popularity among users.
					 The lotion is made with chitosan and liquid extracted from some medicinal plants. Its pigment and perfume are also made with natural raw materials.
					
					 It whitens skin, removes pimples and black spots and cures burn and injury.
					
					 Kim Un Hye, a 29-year-old woman living in Central District, Pyongyang, told KCNA that the lotion has made her face fair and removed inflammation from her face.
					
					 It is experts' view that only the lotion is enough for facial treatment in summer.

articles.title: Korea Jangsu Trading Corporation
articles.content:
Korea Jangsu Trading Corporation
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Kaesong Koryo Insam (ginseng) goods produced by the Korea Jangsu Trading Corporation have become increasingly popular in foreign markets.
					 Among them are natural red insam, insam tea, insam extract, rice mixed with red insam, insam kochujang (hot pepper paste) and canned cucumber mixed with insam.
					
					 Kaesong Koryo Insam has been acknowledged as a world-famous elixir and health foodstuff from olden times.
					
					 The director of the corporation, O Kwang Won, told KCNA that the corporation owns a large acreage of insam fields in Kaesong and has insam processing bases equipped with modern facilities of GMP standards.
					
					 The corporation has proved the efficacy of Kaesong Koryo Insam in a scientific way through researches in its ingredients and medical and clinical action and, on this basis, has improved the quality of its products.
					
					 The Biological and Koryo Medicine Research Center of the corporation introduces its research findings to the World Health Organization and other countries and makes exchanges with them.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Attach Importance to Nation
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Attach Importance to Nation 
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to value the independent requirement and interests of one's own nation, not foreign forces', and firmly rely on the driving force of the nation, not outsiders' strength. This is the master key to solving the issue of the north-south relations and achieving national reunification. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 There go in south Korea ceaseless joint military exercises with outside forces and conspiratorial rackets, all targeted against the DPRK. 
					
					 The cause of national reunification is the one for national independence as it is aimed to put an end to foreign domination and interference in the internal affairs of south Korea and establish national sovereignty throughout Korea. 
					
					 It is absolutely impossible to achieve the reunification of the country and national unity as long as the stand of attaching importance to foreign forces, the stand of giving priority to outside forces, not the stand of attaching importance to the nation, is allowed. 
					
					 While talking about "priority to the south Korea-U.S. relations" and "restoration of the alliance," the present conservative authorities of south Korea have pursued the policy subservient to outside forces, placing the relations with the U.S. above the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					Yielding to the U.S. demands, they have totally scuttled the work for north-south reconciliation and cooperation and escalated north-south confrontation. 
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the present catastrophic consequences entailed by the south Korean authorities' cooperation with foreign forces.
					
					 The reality of the inter-Korean relations in the past and at present goes to prove that the firm adherence to the stand of attaching importance to the nation would help promote national reconciliation and unity and meet Koreans' common wishes and interests but the stand of attaching importance to foreign forces and cooperation with outsiders would make it impossible to properly solve any problem but throw hurdles in the way of accomplishing the cause of national reunification. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to properly understand the desire of the nation and the demand of the times, roll back at once the policy of toeing foreign forces and cooperating with outsiders and take the stand of attaching importance to the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Building New Independent World
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Building New Independent World
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A new independent world is a world where every country's sovereignty is respected. Adhering to a principle of respecting the sovereignty provides every country with an environment favorable for achieving and protecting its sovereignty.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a bylined article. 
					
					 Only when a new international order of respect for sovereignty is established, can all the countries achieve independence on an equal footing, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 If a world where state sovereignty is respected is built, it is possible to ensure international peace and stability. 
					
					 At present aggression and war actions are openly perpetrated in various regions and the world is in disorder. These are attributable to the aggression, war and military intervention of the imperialists who regard the violation of other countries' state sovereignty by force of arms as pleasure. 
					
					 The new independent world is a free and peaceful world without any aggression and war. It is necessary to establish a new international order of respect for sovereignty in order to prevent an unjust aggression and war. 
					
					 A dynamic anti-imperialist struggle is a basic requirement for bringing earlier the above-said international order. 
					
					 It is possible to achieve genuine friendship and cooperation desired by the people in the world where sovereignty is respected. 
					
					 For the anti-imperialist independent countries to boost the capacities for self-defence provides an important guarantee for building an independent world where state sovereignty is respected. 
					
					 The process of expanding and developing the Non-aligned Movement precisely means a process of democratizing and making the whole world independent. 
					
					 Strengthening the South-South cooperation is urgently required for building the above-said world. 
					
					 This world is sure to emerge thanks to the common struggle of humankind.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses US of Its Moves to Establish MD
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses US of Its Moves to Establish MD
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The United States has recently concluded an agreement on the joint development of the missile defence system together with the south Korean puppet forces and test-fired a medium-range ballistic interceptor missile in the Pacific. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard: The above-said actions of the U.S. brought to light its strategic design to stifle the DPRK militarily and establish a military domination over the whole of the Korean Peninsula and, furthermore, over the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 The U.S. claims that the MD pushed forward by it on an unprecedented scale is aimed to cope with the "missile threat" from someone, but it is nothing but a crafty artifice to cover up its aggressive nature, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 By establishing the MD worldwide, the U.S. seeks to fully contain its potential rivals by force of arms and put the world under its military domination. 
					
					 The U.S. has regarded the military domination over the whole of the peninsula as a key link in the chain efforts to establish its military domination over the world. 
					
					 Prompted by this aim, the U.S. is putting spurs to the moves to establish the MD aimed at making a preemptive strike at the DPRK by plugging its satellite forces into them under the pretext of the above-said missile threat. 
					
					 The military tension on the peninsula where the interests of big powers are complicatedly intertwined and which has become one of the world hot spots leads to the escalation of the military tension not only in the Asia-Pacific region but in the rest of the world and sparks an arms race.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times toward peace and immediately give up the aggressive and anachronistic MD.

articles.title: US Neo-liberalist Predatory Policy Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Neo-liberalist Predatory Policy Slammed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea’s Reunification on Sunday issued a statement titled "Let workers take the lead in shattering U.S. imperialists' neo-liberalism and paving a wide avenue for independent reunification".
					Sycophantic and treacherous forces and capital are becoming evermore undisguised in their arbitrary acts in south Korea under the U.S. colonial domination at this time when the 121st May Day is being marked, the statement said.
					
					A large number of workers are suffering pain due to layoff and dismissal and industrial disasters, the ever-increasing number of part-time workers and the crisis in the labor movement. All this is a product of the U.S. neo-liberalist policy.
					
					The south Korean workers, therefore, regarded the opposition to the conclusion of FTA with the U.S. and the pullout of the U.S. forces from south Korea as life and death tasks and have turned out in the struggle to carry them out.
					
					The workers will take the lead in the struggle to terminate the U.S. neo-liberalist predatory policy and achieve the independent reunification, it stressed.

articles.title: Peaceful Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Peaceful Reunification Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea in a statement on May 1 called for achieving peaceful reunification by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					The statement fully supported the struggle of the workers who turned out to judge the present regime which trampled down upon the vital rights of the people from all walks of life and their desire for peaceful reunification on the occasion of May Day.
					
					The period since the present authorities came to power is recorded with all kinds of crimes such as the suppression of the labor movement, the reduction of the taxes to be paid by the rich, environmental pollution, confrontation with fellow countrymen, war moves and sycophancy and treachery, it noted.
					
					It accused the authorities of getting frantic with the purchase of war hardware for invading the north while working with blood-shot eyes to tighten the aggressive alliance with the U.S. and Japan.
					
					It branded this as acts of escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen, increasing the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula and threatening peace.
					
					It called upon the people from all walks of life to get united to judge the present regime and bring earlier peace and reunification.

articles.title: Democratic Labor Party of S. Korea Calls for Joining in Workers' Actions
articles.content:
Democratic Labor Party of S. Korea Calls for Joining in Workers' Actions 
						
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Sunday, May Day.
					The commentary recalled that the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions staged actions in different areas to judge the present regime for causing price rise and deteriorating the people's livelihood. 
					
					The unanimous voices of the two organizations go to prove that the workers' living under the present regime has reached the brink.
					
					It said that the party would positively come out in the actions to judge the present regime in order to put an end to the sufferings of the workers and build a society free from part-time job.
					
					The party will join the workers in their actions to totally revise the Law on Trade Unions as an immediate task, it stressed.

articles.title: Regional Body's Appeal for Commemoration of Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth
articles.content:
Regional Body's Appeal for Commemoration of Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Asian-Pacific regional preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung on April 25 issued an appeal to national and regional preparatory committees and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people on the five continents of the world.
					 The appeal expressed full support for the decision made in the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It called upon those preparatory committees and friendship and solidarity organizations to in response to the decision;
					
					 Form more preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of the President and enhance their role to steadily conduct colorful and peculiar events praising the peerlessly great man everywhere in the world until the Day of the Sun in 2012.
					
					 Take part with sincerity in an international joint commemorations of 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea to be held in Pyongyang on the Day of the Sun in 2012, meetings of awarding honorary titles and conveying gifts to the great persons of Mt. Paektu, visit to Mangyongdae where the President was born, TV joint stage praising his great life and immortal feats and exhibition of books and literary works in praise of the great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Organize preparatory committees for celebrations of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has creditably carried forward and developed the human cause of independence pioneered by the President and splendidly celebrate this day as an international grand festival.
					
					 Take active part in the preparatory work for a world conference for support to Korea's reunification to be held in Pyongyang in April 2012 and extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in the struggle to strictly defend and implement the reunification proposals clarified by the President and the north-south joint declarations provided by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Praised by Pakistani Public Figure
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung Praised by Pakistani Public Figure
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung dedicated all his life to the country's prosperity, people's happiness and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence, said Zabed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, expressing his profound reverence for Kim Il Sung during his visit to the DPRK.
					 He was the founder of the DPRK and the great leader of the Korean people, Zabed Ansari noted, and went on: 
					
					 Progressive humankind warmly praises him as the most outstanding great man recognized by the world.
					
					 Kim Il Sung fully supported and encouraged the people in their struggle to achieve national independence and build a new society.
					
					 He was possessed of immensely broad magnanimity and noble personality. 
					
					 He was quite informal in meeting not only party and state heads of many countries and personages of high reputation but ordinary people. 
					
					 History does not know such outstanding thinker and theoretician and great statesman as Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He founded the Juche idea, clearly indicating the way to be followed by the popular masses to carve out their destiny independently. 
					
					 During my stay in the DPRK I made bow to his statue, renewing my will to follow the road of Juche to the last.
					
					 The world progressive people are now making every sincere effort to greet the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung, the greatest man representing the 20th century, as a great event in the human history. 
					
					 Many preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung have been organized.
					
					 We will conduct diverse activities to laud his undying revolutionary feats.

articles.title: DPRK Important Days Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Important Days Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Laos and Syria gave special write-ups to the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The Lao paper Pasason on April 27 carried an article titled "Invincible KPA" with a photo of Kim Jong Il inspecting a KPA unit. 
					
					 The article said that the KPA has defended socialism and reliably guaranteed the building of a thriving nation, always emerging victorious in the acute confrontation with the hostile forces for decades.
					
					 The main factor of the KPA's Invincibility lies in the distinguished guiding idea and strategy, it said, elaborating on the fact that the KPA has been firmly armed with the Juche-oriented military idea and strategy founded by President Kim Il Sung and steadily developed in depth by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 On the same day, another Lao paper Vatelao carried a photo of Kim Jong Il inspecting a KPA unit and an article introducing the inexhaustible might of the KPA.
					
					 The April 25th issue of the Syrian paper Al Baath elaborated on the undying feats of Kim Jong Il for army building, saying that his election as NDC chairman marked an important occasion in helping the KPA further display its might as an invincible army.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Philippine Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Philippine Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Philippines Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula issued a joint statement on April 15 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 The President is always alive in the hearts of the Juche idea followers, the statement said, adding that he thoroughly applied the Juche idea in the revolution and construction and thereby the Korean people are fully enjoying benefits of socialism.
					
					 The Korean people armed with the steadfast spirit of independence have registered achievements in the economic construction while shattering every ceaseless move of the hostile forces to stifle the DPRK, it noted.
					
					 Censuring the United States and the south Korean authorities for their anti-DPRK and anti-reunification moves, the statement expressed full support for the sincere efforts and principled stand shown by the DPRK for peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Lauding Kim Il Sung's whole life for the people and his undying feats, it called upon the Philippine people to conduct positive work to learn from his noble life.

articles.title: Japanese Dissatisfied with Kan's Leadership
articles.content:
Japanese Dissatisfied with Kan's Leadership
						
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A survey released Saturday showed a total of 76 percent of Japanese are not satisfied with Prime Minister Naoto Kan's leadership in handling the crisis at the Fukushima nuclear power plant, Kyodo News said.
					 The telephone survey, conducted by Kyodo on Friday and Saturday, showed the dissatisfaction for Kan's leadership grew among Japanese citizens, up from 63.7 percent in the previous survey in late March.

articles.title: No Abnormalities Found in Radiation Levels in China
articles.content:
No Abnormalities Found in Radiation Levels in China
 Beijing, May 2 (KCNA) -- Monitoring results showed that radiation levels in the inland environment, the air above the sea and the surface seawater remain normal in China, said China's National Nuclear Emergency Coordination Committee on Monday.
					 No abnormalities in food supplies and drinking water have been detected in sample surveys, it added.

articles.title: China's Premier on Role of Construction Workers from Countryside
articles.content:
China's Premier on Role of Construction Workers from Countryside
 Beijing, May 2 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao referred to the role of construction workers who migrated to cities from their rural hometowns on Sunday when going round a housing construction site in Beijing on the occasion of May Day. 
					 New-type construction workers appeared in the country in the course of urbanization, he noted, saying that construction is unthinkable without those workers.
					
					 The party and government give high priority to the issue of those construction workers, he said, hoping that they would study hard and get accustomed to their business to become competent working people.
					
					 He stressed the need to take hold on the housing issue as big problem related to the people's life and push forward the construction.

articles.title: Ministerial Meeting on Preventing Non-infectious Diseases Held
articles.content:
Ministerial Meeting on Preventing Non-infectious Diseases Held
Moscow, May 2 (KCNA) -- The first world ministerial meeting on preventing non-infectious diseases was held in Moscow on April 28 and 29.
					Present there were delegations and delegates of more than 160 countries including the DPRK.
					
					The meeting discussed the issues of enhancing state and public concern for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease, diabetes and other non-infectious diseases, increasing investment in them, decreasing the use of tobacco and alcohol, the basic factors of the outbreak of illness, and establishing a sound way of life.
					
					The meeting closed by adopting a Moscow declaration on the prevention and treatment of non-infectious diseases.

articles.title: Russia on Establishing MD System in Europe
articles.content:
Russia on Establishing MD System in Europe
Moscow, May 2 (KCNA) -- The commander of the Space Armed Forces of Russia in a press conference on April 29 referred to the issue of establishing the missile defense system in Europe.
					If Russia is to establish the MD in Europe in union with NATO, its concern about the plan of NATO's unilateral establishment of MD will disappear, he said.
					
					It is unnecessary for MD of other countries to be deployed in regions where Russia's missile shields are provided, he added.

articles.title: Zhirinovsky Asks for Putting Oil Field under State's Control in Russia
articles.content:
Zhirinovsky Asks for Putting Oil Field under State's Control in Russia
 Moscow, May 2 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Zhirinovsky, leader of the Liberal Democratic Party and deputy speaker of the State Duma of Russia, on April 28 demanded that the state put the oil industrial field under its control.
					 Noting that gasoline price is rising in the country because of shortage of fuel in its different areas, he said that this may be caused by private companies which export fuel for their own sake.
					
					 The state should control the rise of price in oil products, he said, adding that in case the situation is not improved, his Party would submit a bill on nationalizing the oil field to the State Duma.

articles.title: Latin American Countries Work for Economic Alliance
articles.content:
Latin American Countries Work for Economic Alliance 
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Mexico, Colombia, Chile and Peru agreed to establish an economic alliance.
					 Their presidents signed an agreement on it in Lima of Peru on April 28, expressing their commitment to pursue integration of their economies and a strengthening of trade links with the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: Angola Condemns Western Countries´ Interventionist Policy
articles.content:
Angola Condemns Western Countries' Interventionist Policy
						
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos denounced the Western for its intervention in African countries on Friday when speaking at the opening of the IV Extraordinary Congress of the People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola.
					 He said that some Western countries carry out reprehensible military interventions aimed at determining the solution of internal affairs of sovereign states.
					
					 "Africa is used as field of experiment for that policy, whose objective is the easy access to raw materials and the rebirth of neo-colonialism", said the president.
					
					 He called for the strengthening of national unity and the consolidation of peace to cope with such action.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Three soldiers of NATO troops in Afghanistan were killed by the attack operation of the resistance forces of the country on April 28.
					 Two died when a bomb exploded in the south and a third was killed by insurgents in the east.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Panama
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Panama
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A magnitude-6.0 earthquake jolted the southern coast of Panama on April 30.
					 The epicenter was waters off this region.

articles.title: May Day Marked in Cuba
articles.content:
May Day Marked in Cuba
Havana, May 2 (KCNA) -- May Day was marked in Cuba.
					A ceremony took place at Antonio Maceo Square in Santiago de Cuba City on Sunday.
					
					Raul Castro, president of the Council of State of Cuba, was present at the ceremony together with huge masses.
					
					The general secretary of the Santiago de Cuba Provincial Committee of the Center of the Cuban Workers, speaking at the ceremony, called upon all the working people to get united and build a better society for Cuba and the world.
					
					Then followed a demonstration.
					
					Its participants marched, chanting slogans with national flags and placards bearing the letters supporting the line adopted at the Sixth Congress of the Communist Party of Cuba in their hands.

articles.title: May Day Celebrated in China
articles.content:
May Day Celebrated in China
 Beijing, May 2 (KCNA) -- The All-China Federation of Trade Unions held a meeting at the Great Hall of the People on April 28 to celebrate May Day.
					 Chairman Wang Zhaoguo in his speech at the meeting congratulated the working people across the country on May Day. It is the honorable mission and sacred duty of the Chinese working class to implement the target and tasks of the 12th Five-Year Plan, he said. 
					
					 He stressed the need for the broad sections of working people to strive in unity to build a comprehensively well-off society and accelerate the socialist modernization by fully displaying the great personality of the working class and the spirit of labor innovators.

articles.title: Detenidos japoneses por sus delitos cometidos en Corea
articles.content:
Detenidos japoneses por sus delitos cometidos en Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Según la información correspondiente de la ATCC publicada este miércoles, fueron detenidos el 14 de marzo pasado por un órgano competente los japoneses que entraron en la ciudad de Rason de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y cometieron los crímenes vinculados con narcóticos y falsificación de billetes: el ex director-delegado de la Compañía JP Dairin S.A., Masaki Furuya, el director-delegado de la Compañía Realise S.A., Hidehiko Abe, y el director de la Compañía Industrial Sugita S.A., Takumi Hirooka.
					Ellos reconocieron su culpabilidad y la gravedad de sus delitos. 
					
					Masaki Furuya ya fue deportado del territorio coreano y los dos restantes están en procesamiento legal. 
					
					Sus crímenes contravienen a la ley de la RPDC y al derecho internacional y les pesará la merecida responsabilidad legal.

articles.title: XIII Seminario de Ciencias Médicas de Pyongyang
articles.content:
XIII Seminario de Ciencias Médicas de Pyongyang 
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar los días 3 y 4 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el XIII Seminario de Ciencias Médicas de Pyongyang de los coreanos en el interior y el exterior del país.
					Asistieron a la ocasión Ri Pong Hun, presidente del Comité Central de la Asociación de Médicos de Corea, y otros funcionarios de salud pública, los científicos de la rama y la delegación de la Asociación de Médicos Coreanos residentes en Japón presidida por su titular Kim Yong Il.
					
					En su discurso inaugural, Ri Pong Hun deseó que este foro contribuya al desarrollo de las ciencias médicas de la nación y a la prosperidad del país bajo el ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					En su discurso de felicitación, Kim Yong Il exhortó a los médicos compatriotas del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar a aportar al desarrollo de ciencias médicas nacionales y al cumplimiento de la causa de reunificación de la patria. 
					
					En la ocasión se presentaron las disertaciones que dan a conocer los resultados de investigación sobre algunos temas importantes.
					
					Se enumeraron también los éxitos y experiencias alcanzados en el proceso de solucionar los apremiantes problemas científico-técnicos y aplicar en la profilaxis y el tratamiento las tecnologías sofisticadas.
					
					Los exponentes de monografías recibieron diplomas.

articles.title: RPDC devuelve restos mortales de piloto británico
articles.content:
RPDC devuelve restos mortales de piloto británico
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Quedaron devueltos hoy a la parte de Gran Bretaña por vía de Phanmunjom los restos mortales del piloto británico, Desmond Fredrick William Hinton, caído en la pasada guerra coreana (1950-1953).
					Accediendo a la petición encarecida de sus familiares que desconocían durante varias décadas el paradero de él, en 2002, el gobierno británico propuso oficialmente al gobierno de la República Popular Democrática de Corea la búsqueda de los restos mortales de Hinton.
					
					Bajo la autorización del gobierno de la RPDC, la Representación del Ejército Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom realizó la investigación en varias ocasiones, desenterró y confirmó exactamente los restos mortales y las pertenencias de Hinton. 
					
					Además, los sepultó con mucho cuidado en el mismo lugar de hallazgo a instancia de los familiares y les facilitó a éstos las condiciones para visitar la tumba.
					
					En marzo de este año, ellos pidieron que les permitiera llevar los restos mortales a su patria.
					
					Respetando tal solicitud, la representación del EPC en Phanmunjom volvió a desenterrar los restos mortales y las pertenencias de Hinton en cooperación sincera con la embajada británica en Corea y los devolvió esta vez a sus familiares. 
					
					La primera devolución de restos mortales se realizó el 30 de octubre de 1995 en el caso de J. Edmuns, soldado de segunda clase de las fuerzas terrestres de Gran Bretaña. 
					
					  La parte británica expresó profundo agradecimiento al gobierno de la RPDC por su sinceridad mostrada en esa labor humanitaria y vaticinó que tal cooperación será un paso positivo al desarrollo de relaciones bilaterales. 
					
					  La Representación del EPC en Phanmunjom expresó la posición de cooperar activamente en lo adelante también en el desenterramiento y la devolución de restos mortales, que constituyen un proyecto humanitario para eliminar las heridas de la pasada guerra coreana.

articles.title: Servicio médico a larga distancia en Corea
articles.content:
Servicio médico a larga distancia en Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Se ha establecido en todo el país la red de servicio médico a larga distancia.
					Según las estadísticas, llegó a centenares durante los últimos dos años y medio el número de los pacientes tratados con ese tipo de asistencia médica.
					
					Dado que esta labor exige analizar y diagnosticar el estado del enfermo y los valores de laboratorio comunicándose a través de la pantalla, el Hospital Kim Man Yu compuso el consultorio con los médicos expertos.
					
					Participan activamente en ese trabajo los galenos competentes de varias unidades sanitarias, incluyendo el Hospital de la Escuela de Medicina de Pyongyang de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, el Instituto de Tumores de la Academia de Ciencias Médicas, la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang, el Centro de Prevención de Enfermedades Dermatológicas y el Hospital Estomatológico, del Ministerio de Salud Pública.
					
					Como resultado, muchos pacientes, que padecían encefalopatía y cardiopatía que necesitan las operaciones quirúrgicas, se han recuperado siendo tratados a tiempo.
					
					Se beneficiaron igualmente los enfermos de dudosa diagnosis y los que no se mejoraban pese al uso de medicinas recomendadas.
					
					Es gratis en Corea el servicio médico a la larga distancia.
